text: The Indian elephant (Elephas maximus indicus) is one of three subspecies of the Asian elephant. It comes from mainlandAsia. Since 1986, E. maximus indicus has been listed as endangered by IUCN. The population has declined by at least 50% over the last 60â€“75 years. The subspecies is also threatened by habitat loss, degradation and herds being split apart into smaller groups.Choudhury, A. and others (IUCN SSC Asian Elephant Specialist Group) 2008. It is recognized as the National animal of India. ==References== Category:Mammals of Asia Category:Elephants Category:National symbols of India
title: Indian elephant
